instruction: Can the hierarchical convolutional neural network (H-CNN) using Raman spectral data be considered a superior method compared to traditional recognition methods for accurately identifying and classifying different stages of cervical cancer tissue sections?
Output: Yes, the hierarchical convolutional neural network (H-CNN) using Raman spectral data can be considered a superior method compared to traditional recognition methods for accurately identifying and classifying different stages of cervical cancer tissue sections. The experimental results of the study show that H-CNN has apparent advantages in terms of recognition accuracy, stability, and sensitivity compared to traditional methods such as Bayesian classifier (NB), decision tree classifier (DT), support vector machine classifier (SVM), and CNN. The classification Macro-Accuracy, Macro-Recall, Macro-F1, and Macro-AUC of H-CNN are reported to be high, reaching 94.91%, 95.31%, 95.23%, and 97.35% respectively. This indicates that H-CNN can accurately identify and classify different classes of tissue sections, making it a superior method for diagnosing different stages of cervical cancer.
